column2: It's been some time since I've last felt the influence of my Prince... And yet, now, in their absence, I hear the faint whispers of another... It seems I have a choice to make.

Recently, I've felt a calling in the back of my mind. A presence, sinister and treacherous, promising great power... I had considered it a hallucination at first, nothing more than an idle thought caused by lack of sleep, but the presence persists... promising power and fortune, to those who would serve it...
If my Prince has abandoned me, I will forsake them as well!
Power overwhelming... Now that has a very nice ring to it...
Though my Prince has forsaken me, I doubt my betrayal would be forgiven.
Perhaps, with further research in the privacy of my libraries...
I am a loyal servant of my Prince!
As a siren they would lure me to my doom. I will not be seduced!
While travelling your demesne, an interesting object catches your eye not far off the road. It may be something as mundane as a peasant's misplaced farming tool, but what if it isn't...?
This warrants further investigation!
No, objects at the roadside don't concern me.

As you lift the object to take a closer look, it crumbles to dust in your hand! It was a trap! A demonic yet somehow quite pathetic voice echoes from behind you - "While you were out arranging betrothals, I studied the blade!" the shout came. You turn about to see a rather portly katana-wielding Dremora, and he seems to be waddling right for you!
DIE! DIE! DIE!
Upon closer inspection, it appears the object that caught your eye was none other than a nest of extremely territorial enchanted hornets! You're in for it now, buddy.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] preserve me...
Trifling bees! Tremble before the power of a Tongue!
Wait... what's that noise?

You immediately turn to flee, heading off as quickly as you can. Whether you truly outran the apian assailants or they just lost interest is of little matter to you - you're safe, and unscathed. Perhaps next time, you think, you'll reconsider investigating strange objects at the side of the road...

You turn to flee and manage to escape the majority of the swarm, but a small portion persistently stays on your trail, delivering a few harsh stings before you successfully lose them. In retrospect, maybe grabbing strange objects at the roadside was not your most well-thought-out plan.

Realizing you stand no chance against this magically-enhanced menace, you turn to flee and take off as fast as you can, but the bees are persistent and harry you the entire way. Upon returning home, your personal physician takes one look at you and sighs, heading off to fetch his instruments.

You turn to flee, but your foot gets caught on a root, sending you crashing to the ground as the swarm of hornets wash over you, stinging every part of your body imaginable. You have nothing left to do but count the stings as they are inflicted. 998... 999... and suddenly, the world goes dark.

You smirk as the bees seek to challenge you, and triumphantly place your hands upon your hips. "Go ahead and sting me, bees!" you shout, "I'm immune!" and it certainly appears to be true - the stings of the fearsome hornets do little more than tickle you, probably owing to the sting you once experienced as a child. This day, you are victorious.

Or, at least, you would be, if they did not appear to be quite docile... You open your pack, and the swarm of hornets flies in, seemingly claiming your bag as its new nest. That went far better than you expected.

FUS... RO DAH! you shout, the dragontongue reverberating throughout the air as the bees are scattered and torn apart by the sheer force of your imposing voice. You're sure that whoever enchanted this hornet's nest did not count on a tongue of your caliber coming across it.

FUS... RO DAH! you shout, the dragontongue reverberating throughout the air as the bees are scattered and torn apart by the sheer force of your imposing voice. You're sure that whoever enchanted this hornet's nest did not count on a tongue of your caliber coming across it - and what's more, you seem to have found something they were guarding!

KHRYA-YA-YA-YA comes the call, and in the blink of an eye your pet badger has placed itself between you and the threat! The swarm hesitates, and your badger charges, scattering the bees and chasing them off, leaving the nest unoccupied.

KHRYA-YA-YA-YA comes the call, and in the blink of an eye your pet badger has placed itself between you and the threat! The swarm hesitates, and your badger charges, scattering the bees and chasing them off, leaving the nest unoccupied. Taking another look, you notice a treasure the nest seemed to be guarding. Well, it's yours now!

You raise an eyebrow as you draw your own blade, easily parrying your opponent's blow and driving a counter straight for his oversized gut, plunging through it like a hot knife through butter - wait, is that actually butter? No matter - you clean your blade off as the Dremora fades back to oblivion, leaving behind only his sword - black and red, of course. You shrug, slinging it over your shoulder and taking it home with you.

The aggressive waddling of your opponent takes you offguard, but you nonetheless draw steel, catching his first blow and beginning an earnest duel. You two go back and forth, both scoring hits on eachother, but eventually your opponent begins to pant. You've outlasted him! You go in for the kill, striking him down and sending him back to Oblivion!

The large and quite hairy dremora collides with you, sending you falling to the ground. You roll out of the way of his blade, but get caught on one of its many spikes, grievously injuring you. He stops suddenly, opening his mouth and beginning to gloat. "Such is the fate of all of those who stand against COLDSTEEL THE DREMORA," he begins, but has no time to continue before your blade finds its way into his throat, ending his short moment of triumph. You sigh and head home.

Your reflexes are somehow even slower than your opponent's, and he effortlessly (though quite sluggishly) slashes his blade across your chest, leaving you grievously wounded. As you move to draw your own blade, one of his blade's many spikes impales your wrist before he wimpily kicks you to the ground. Standing over you, he smirks. "Nothing personal, kid..." the Dremora mutters, plunging his blade through your chest.
It could've been worse...
My reputation will suffer...
Argh... it hurts...
A crossbow bolt would've been quicker...
Haha, I'm not even in the F-Bee-I, stupid!
I will show them all what the buzz is about!
If only I could solve all my problems this way.
I hope it's a cough-drop...
You just do what you want, hm?
Let's get that loot and head home!
Ow! That's a really sharp edge!
I'd rather not even think about that...
To think I was almost defeated in such a way...
Darkness envelops me.
Escape isn't an option - draw steel!
Think quickly!
Show the swarm the power of the voice!
Is that--
Relinquish Your Throne

If you find yourself unfit to rule and believe your successor more capable, you may choose to abdicate your titles in favor of your current heir, allowing you to play as them without having to await the slow, painful death of your current ruler.
Upgrade Provincial Infrastructure

By upgrading a province's infrastructure, buildings construct faster, armies move quicker, reinforcements are drawn up more quickly, and it's easier to supply troops in the field. Be aware, however, that well-maintained infrastructure is not cheap...
Repair Provincial Infrastructure
If your infrastructure is damaged, you may spend money to repair it.
Basic Infrastructure
The first steps of progress have been made in the constructions of roads and bridges in this province, providing some benefit to the populace, although certainly not to full potential.
Average Infrastructure
Paved roads and stone bridges are becoming more common, allowing citizens and soldiers alike easier passage throughout the land.
Advanced Infrastructure

This province's infrastructure is considered quite advanced, with well-maintained highways, paved roads, sturdy bridges, and workers dedicated to maintaining them. People and goods move across the land with ease, with matters of supply being little trouble.
Exceptional Infrastructure

The august infrastructure in this province is cutting-edge, incorporating methods both mundane and magical to quickly move workers, supplies, goods, and soldiers across the land. Clearly no expense was spared in this venerable undertaking, and others would do well to learn from it.
Damaged Infrastructure
This province has suffered damage to its infrastructure and will need to be repaired before it returns to full capacity.
Damaged Infrastructure
This province has suffered damage to its infrastructure and will need to be repaired before it returns to full capacity.
Damaged Infrastructure
This province has suffered damage to its infrastructure and will need to be repaired before it returns to full capacity.
Damaged Infrastructure
This province has suffered damage to its infrastructure and will need to be repaired before it returns to full capacity.
Recent Construction
This province has recently had infrastructure constructed or repaired, and it will take some time before the resources and manpower can be again assembled to upgrade or repair it further.
Expelling Locals
The local populace is being subjected to a campaign of expulsion by order of their Lord.
Massacring Locals
The local populace is being subjected to a campaign of extermination by order of their Lord. Needless to say, they are not very pleased with this.
Depopulated Province

The few remaining residents of this land are sparse and scattered. Once-bustling communities are silent save for the whistling of the wind through the burnt-out husks of abandoned shops and houses. Nature reclaims fields untilled and vines strangle broken stone. Were it not for these last remnants of those former inhabitants, one would think that none had been present at all.
Minor Repopulation
The local government has taken some minor measures to aid in the reconstruction and repopulation of this province.
Middling Repopulation
The local government has taken some middling measures to aid in the reconstruction and repopulation of this province.
Major Repopulation
The local government is supporting major efforts to reconstruct and repopulate the province.
Refugee Diaspora
This province is home to a large refugee community, fleeing the persecution they faced in their homeland. This has contributed to a cultural and economic boom.
Resettle Province
There are very few people left in this province. We should send some settlers to alleviate that.
End Conversion Efforts
If, for some reason or another, you no longer desire this province's conversion, you may end the initiatives towards it.
As [Root.GetName] is properly [Root.Culture.GetName] as we are, we have elected to cease any and all crimes against the local populace.
As [Root.GetName] is not of our culture, we have disestablished the efforts of the previous administration to resettle it with the [Root.Culture.GetName] people.
We have scattered the few remaining inhabitants of [Root.GetName] and replaced them with our own settlers. [Root.GetName] is now [Root.Holder.Culture.GetName] territory.
Our efforts against the [Root.Culture.GetName] people of [Root.GetName] have been halted due to the province having fallen into the hands of our enemy!
What shall we do about the locals, my [FromFrom.GetTitle]?
The [Root.Culture.GetName] people may remain, but they must learn of our customs.
The [Root.Culture.GetName] inhabitants of [Root.GetName] must be driven out.
Slaughter them to the last. [Root.GetName] will be [FromFrom.Culture.GetName].
Seed the Hist! [Root.GetName] must support the [FromFrom.Culture.GetName] people!
Our magistrates have drawn up a plan to begin assimilating [From.GetName] - shall we give the order?
Resistance is futile.

Long hours of consulting with our shamans have resulted in a plan for spreading the Hist to [Root.GetName]. They simply need the word - and some supplies - and they will begin our terraforming efforts.
Springtime for [Root.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!

Through considerable time and effort, the Hist has successfully colonized [Root.GetName]. With steady waves of colonists moving in, it is safe to say that [Root.GetName] is effectively [Root.Culture.GetName]
Our forces are standing by to drive out the [From.Culture.GetName] people of [From.GetName]. They will, of course, not be pleased, and are unlikely to take this passively.
What will they do? Bleed on us?

Our forces have marched through the night to arrive on the outskirts of [From.GetName]. An uneasy sense of trepidation coats the air like a thick slime. A collection of locals have assembled, demanding to know the meaning of this intrusion. But from the haggard looks in their eyes, it would appear that this was not unexpected.
Wipe them out. All of them..

The expulsion of the locals of [Root.GetName] has been completed, and rather uneventfully at that. If you are so inclined, my [Root.Owner.GetTitle], the province is now open to resettlement by our own citizens.

The expulsion of the locals of [Root.GetName] has been completed, and if you are so inclined, my [Root.Owner.GetTitle], the province is now open to resettlement by our own citizens. However - a large group of the disaffected have taken up arms against us!

The massacre of the locals of [Root.GetName] has been completed, their homes burnt and people put to the sword. What little resistance they offered was quickly put down by our forces, and the province is now open to resettlement.

The massacre of the locals of [Root.GetName] has been largely completed, their homes burnt and people put to the sword. While the province is now open to resettlement, a large group of survivors have formed a resistance against you.

The province of [Root.GetName], whether by our hand or another's, is left bereft of a sustainable population. We could wait for it to repopulate naturally, or we could take some measures to accelerate the process...
Some minor investment may speed things along.
A moderate investment would be a bigger help.
A major investment is the right decision.
These things must happen naturally.
Our magistrates estimate that an investment of half a year's income should reduce the amount of time it would take to resettle [From.GetName] by about a quarter.
Half a year's income? A small price to pay.
Our magistrates estimate that an investment of three-quarters of a year's income should reduce the amount of time it would take to resettle [From.GetName] by about half.
Three-quarters of a year's income... This better be worth it.
Our magistrates estimate that an investment of a year's income should reduce the amount of time it would take to resettle [From.GetName] by three-quarters..
A year's income? Well, if no expense must be spared...

It's been some time since our settlers first broke ground in [Root.GetName] with the aim of rebuilding a flourishing populace, and today their efforts yield fruit. A courier from the local administration has arrived, informing us that they believe the population is again sustainable and the economy has healed!
The dark forces corrupting [Root.GetName] have been expelled, and our own settlers are slowly being moved in to fill the void they left. While it may take some time, the land will recover.
Convert Provincial Culture
The current inhabitants of this province do not follow our customs. We should find a solution for this...
End Conversion Efforts
If, for some reason or another, you no longer desire this province's conversion, you may end the initiatives towards it.
Don't bother me about this again!
Another time, perhaps.
Cleanse Evil
This province is home to a great evil poised to threaten all life on Nirn. Send your troops forth to drive it out!
Cleansing Evil
Soldiers in this province are in a protracted campaign against dark forces that call it their own.

For your efforts against the dark and unnatural forces plaguing this world, the Lords and Ladies of your realm and beyond wish to recognize your service. They would, should you accept it, grant you the title of "The Lion" and a small stipend of gold in recognition of your ferocity and diligence in the defense of the mortal plane.
The Lion, huh? I could get used to that...
No, the deed itself is enough.

Your evil deeds have earned you the ire of many, and repeated crimes against innocents are unlikely to be forgiven. Like as not, you have established a reputation for yourself that you will carry until the end of your days.
What do the opinions of outsiders mean to me anyways?
Genocidal Maniac
[Root.GetDynName] is known for [Root.GetHerHis] crimes against the people as well as the peace, and is thought of accordingly.
Scourge of the Living
[Root.GetDynName] has a long and bloody history of crimes against the mortal races of Nirn.
Barbarian Menace
[Root.GetDynName] is considered the bane of civilized society, and is prone to leaving rivers of blood and mountains of bodies in [Root.GetHerHis] wake.
Testing!
This is my modifier I use for testing random localization. Has no effects otherwise :p

The library brims with hundreds of tomes on just as many subjects, surely collected over a long period of time by its caretakers. You find a book that catches your eye, and take it to the counter. "Why, yes, we would be willing to part with this book for a time... Provided, of course, that you make a small donation in return..."
A small price to pay for knowledge.
That 'donation' is exorbitant! And I can't even keep the book?!
I want a book that I can keep!

After intense study and careful research, you think you may have learned something after all. You take the book and head back to the library, placing the book on the counter. You glance back to the shelves - after all, there's so much more to learn...

Many sleepless nights you've spent trying to make sense of the book you acquired from that library, and many sleepless nights you've yielded nothing to show for it. With a sigh, you bring the book back to the library, and consider getting another...
Hmm, what about that one...
No, I've learned enough for now.
Perhaps this one will yield better luck...
I won't spend another drake in this dustheap!

The curator raises an eyebrow at you. "Certainly..." he says, his voice laden with thinly-veiled disdain. He disappears behind his counter and into a back room, pulling out a considerably less impressive-looking book. "You can keep this one - it's practically worthless. To me, of course - not to you. Supply and demand, after all..."
Begrudgingly hand over the fare
Visit a Library
A visit to a repository of knowledge such as an archive, library, or book store is an excellent way to improve said knowledge. Rarely are these services free, however.
Receive one out of a large selection of books.

Would you like to renounce your current bloodline and request your descendants do the same? This action cannot be undone, and your prestige may be damaged as a result. Children will not have a chance to object.
Yes, it will pay off in the long run.
Word has arrived that [From.GetName] has renounced the bloodline of the dynasty's ancestors, and is now requesting that you do the same.
I can only hope [From.GetSheHe] knows what [From.GetSheHe]'s doing...
My [FromFrom.GetLordLady], I wish to inform you that I have followed your example in renouncing our Dynasty's erstwhile bloodline. Although I do not know your reasoning, I trust your judgment.

My [FromFrom.GetLordLady], I regret to inform you that I cannot do as you ask and renounce our Dynasty's bloodline. I cannot see the logic in this decision and thus am unable to assent to this request.
Renounce Bloodline
If you are dissatisfied with your bloodline, you may choose to renounce your ancestry, and hope your descendants do the same.
Lose any bloodline traits. This cannot be undone!
Two of the below must be true
Three of the below must be true
Four of the below must be true
Five of the below must be true
Six of the below must be true

Couriers have been dispatched to all corners of Tamriel with news from the Imperial Isle - the Commune is dead, and in its place the new Imperial Republic rises. With power wrested away from the old Imperial Elite, the Republic discards the old fetters of the Commune, now limited only by their ambition and their rivals. It is a glorious day for Cyrodiil.
What will happen from here?

With the Imperial Isle and the Imperial City with it falling into the hands of an enemy realm, the administrative institutions that make up our government can no longer function. The old Imperial Elite are displaced, their institutions dislodged, and their grasp of power broken. The remnants of the Elder Council no longer hold any sway over the realm, discarding the legacy of the old Reman Dynasty and the Akaviri Potentate. Our destiny is our own.
Dark days are upon us...

You've done it! Your achievements are certain to rival the old Emperors themselves! Having (or having mostly) united Cyrodiil, you have largely brought an end to the infighting in the Imperial Province, and your rule is unquestioned. The people of Cyrodiil look to you, to guide them into a bright new age without the shackles of those who sought to mimic Elder Council holding you back. You have work to do.
This day is a glorious one.

Throughout your time ruling [Root.Realm.GetName], you've done many questionable things, and ordered even more. The legacy of the atrocities you leave behind you seems to have left a lasting impact on your personality, and you can no longer consider yourself the caring soul you once were.
Artificial moral concepts merely get in the way.

The trails of blood and death you leave behind you as you consign thousands to death at the mark of a pen have called into question your concept of justice. While you once may have been considered a great ruler, fair and feared, fear is now the only thing left to you.
And who are they to judge my leadership?

The time it would take, you've realized, to peacefully assimilate the conquered cultures to follow [Root.Culture.GetName] customs is unacceptable in your eyes. Why teach when you can simply kill, expel, and replace? The means do not matter to you, simply the ends, and the ends must be reached as fast as possible.
Who ever said patience was a virtue?

Lately, you've found it hard to sit peacefully upon your throne. A constant nagging feeling in the back of your mind preventing you from being at ease - the pervasive knowledge that blood is on your hands. You will have to learn to deal with this feeling.
This does not bode well...

While walking through a smoldering village razed at your order, a sight catches your eye - an emaciated mother, huddling amongst the ashes and ruins with her young child. Only the trails of tears break the ash upon her face. You maintain eye-contact for a brief moment, eventually sighing and walking on. Their fates, after all, are of no consequence to you.
Charity is for fools and wastrels anyways...

Laying waste to entire populations certainly leaves a [Root.GetManWoman] with no shortage of enemies. You are finding it harder and harder to trust people these days - anyone upon your streets could be a disaffected survivor, after all.
Trust is weakness!

Your actions have shown your lack of patience for things taking their natural course. You, rather, are inclined to speed up a lengthy process - at swordpoint. No cost too great, no consequence too grave. If there is something in this world you desire, you have determined you will have it. By any means necessary.
They will yet learn to fear my name.

Your patience has worn increasingly thin since you've set down the path of conquest. Your courtiers avoid you for fear of invoking your hair-triggered wrath, and your subjects live wary of whatever you might inflict upon them in your anger.
I have no tolerance for such foolishness!

You've come to the conclusion that, perhaps, you quite enjoy the suffering you inflict upon others. The burnt corpses and homes your armies leave behind them are monuments to the achievements of your indomitable will, and serve as a statement - all who oppose you will share such a fate. You smile, content with this knowledge.
Nobody would dare cross me.

While walking through the corridors of your hall, a low noise grabs your attention. Quiet at first, but progressively increasing in volume. Somebody is calling your name, but it is no courtier you recognize. You make your way towards the castle doors, and before you in your courtyard stands an increasingly large crowd of people - men, women, and children, bloodied and butchered, bearing all manners of mutilation. "[Root.GetDynName], you have been judged... And we are your reckoning..." they cry. The sky turns crimson and the world around you begins to splinter apart. You shoot up, a cold sweat dripping down your face. It would seem you were dreaming.
They're coming for me, I'm sure of it...

You find yourself reflecting upon the days of old. Leading your victorious conquests across the continent, expanding your realm by any means necessary, and putting to the sword all who opposed you. Despite being reviled by your contemporaries, you find yourself wondering if it's not yet too late to put your past behind you and make a change in your life.
Perhaps I should change my ways...
I see no reason to extend mercy. Not now, nor ever.
In your efforts to redeem yourself, you will be unable to massacre or expel the peoples you conquer.
Receive a sum of gold or a random loot item of varying quality.
Daedric Horde
A Daedric Horde calls this province home, rampaging across the land and leaving desolation in its wake.
Undead Horde
An Undead Horde has been risen in this province, and most of the former inhabitants now serve within it.

Glancing down at the artifact before you and perhaps owing to the sharp pain you're now experiencing, you realize that the ring you are about to place upon your finger is a Ring of Sunfire, very lethal to vampires. Wearing it would mean certain death - but, perhaps that's what you're after...
Finally, an end to this curse...
Agh, no, get it off!
The Ring of Happiness you've put on certainly seems to live up to its name - you're feeling better already!
What a relief!
§KElder Kings:§! AI Handicap
Standard Handicapping
§G(Recommended)§! Provides the AI with a random stimulus of gold and possibly techpoints every year. This tends to result in a livelier world.
Extreme Handicapping
This setting will make the AI more likely to receive higher amounts of gold and tech. This setting was not made with balance in mind and should be used only for challenge runs.
Disable the AI handicap event. They will have a much harder time keeping up with the player, and the rest of the world will likely be a decrepit backwater.
§KElder Kings:§! Council Commanders
Ineligible
§G(Recommended)§! Councillors will no longer be eligible for the 'Commander' minor title, removing the micromanagement involved in manually removing the commander role from them.
Eligible (Vanilla)
Councillors will not lose their commander title upon appointment and will continue to be eligible for the role. If you select this option know that I'm judging you.
Provincial ruins will be destroyed!

Mismanaged excavation efforts and structural neglect under the guidance of our [Root.Holder.GetTreasurerName] have resulted in damage to a section of the ruins in [Root.GetName]! It will be some time before we can resume archeological digs on the site.
Such things happen...
Damn them, let's see how much damage they can cause from my dungeons!
Dispatch an emergency repair team!
The workers manage to mitigate the damage already done, and prevent additional damage!
The workers fail to resolve the situation!
Toggle Plot Options
This quality-of-life decision will allow you to select whether or not you wish to be invited to plots. Choosing to deny all plot invitations will override the other two choices.
Select your plot invitation preferences! Note that denying all plot invitations will take precedence over the other two settings, but allowing plot invitations again will respect those choices.
Decline All Plots
Allow All Plots
Decline Artifact Theft Plots
Allow Artifact Theft Plots
Decline Kidnapping Plots
Allow Kidnapping Plots
Vassal Title Laws
This law group controls what titles your vassals may or may not create.
Restricted Vassal Kingdoms
Restricted

The Monarch has outlawed the creation of Titular Kingdoms. While vassals who possess a large enough swathe of land to hold legitimate claim to a High Kingdom will not be impeded, Minor Kings have gone the way of the Cyrodiilic Bird Men.
Free Vassal Kingdoms
Free
Vassals possess autonomy in the creation of titular kingdoms.

As you return to your chambers after a celebration of your ill-gained power, you feel an odd sensation - the very world seems less hospitable to you, and your faculties begin to fail. You dread that you have done something you should not have in defying the weave of fate.
